fields.bio: John McClane was born on May 23, 1955 in Plainfield, New Jersey. His father was an Irish-American cop who made service in New Jersey and his mother was a house cleaner. In his youth, John attended a catholic school. His parents died as he was growing up. From 1972 - 1975, John served in the United States Marine Corps during the Vietnam War, where he served as a tunnel rat, and rose to the rank of sergeant.

Not much is known about Hans Gruber's early life except that he enjoyed making models in his youth. He also claimed to have received a classical education; that claim being bolstered by an intellectual remark about Alexander the Great.
